summary: The document is a CIA report released under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992, detailing a Soviet military alert in West Germany following the assassination of President Kennedy. It includes observations of military activities and alerts in the Soviet bloc, particularly around Berlin, and mentions no indications of preparation for attack by Soviet bloc forces during the reviewed period.
key_findings: Special alert measures were ordered in the Oranienburg-Garrison for NVA units and possibly Soviet Army units following Kennedy's assassination, confined to the Berlin area.
No indications of preparation for attack by Soviet bloc forces during the week of 20-26 November 1963.
Control posts have been staggered in depths of up to 1 kilometer from the interzonal border during weekend nights since mid-October 1963.
Tentative indications of activity outside garrisons of elements of the 34th Artillery since 26 November 1963.
One F-Class submarine passed northward through the Great Belt on 25 November 1963.
